intro: Cerastium tatrense, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers in early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Cerastium tatrense is often found in high-altitude meadows and is an important component of alpine flora.
